content: quote: Originally posted by jdksfcret: This youtube vid will pizz some off and get a Hoo-Ahh from others. Question is, does this help or harm our effort in Iraq...??? >>>http://www.harpers.org/archive/2009/03/hbc-90004477 I have been in that exact same situation and I have taken a similar course of action a few times. If you have a group of soldiers, police in this case, and you need something done the direct approach can be effective. It works best if have a rapport with the unit, and have helped them in the past. The biggest part of his speech was threatening to cut off equipment, that usually works. He obviously has previous history with this IP unit. The profanity is excessive, that is a cultural thing that can backfire so I wouldn't have used that much. This is one moment in time, we can't possibly know how it is normally. I was a LT acting as the advisor to an Iraqi Brigadier General and up to eight Colonels. I had to be direct and forceful at times to let them know they were not going to manipulate me just to get what they wanted without contributing to the mission. If I thought something was corrupt I told them. If I thought they were being cowards I told them. When they would whine about not having equipment to do their job I would point out what they did have. It was a tough love approach, and sometimes it was sink or swim.

content: I couldn't make out the rank, but that officer is my new hero. That said: His approach is counter productive. You cannot shame the Iraqis into being effective combat troops. You cannot shame them into having western ideas of honor and courage. You cannot shame them into standing up for their counrty. Its that simple. We can teach and equip them. But in the end the Iraqis will sink or swim because of their culture. Because of the things they as a culture beleive in..because of a collective work ethic, a common fundamental view of right and wrong...they will succeed of fail based on a common framework... Think about that..because the same shift is taking place here. We can embrace the things that made this nation great..or we can keep going down the same path we've been on for 35 years. We can stand up and say: THIS IS RIGHT. THIS IS WRONG. Or we can keep pretending that everything is equal..that whatever Billy wants to do is okay..or god dammit we start judging people and holding them to a standard.

content: I had one group of IA soldiers that had been working longer, harder, and better than most that I had trained previously. As a result towards the end of the day I gave them one of the soccer balls that I always kept in my truck. The next day they asked for another one, I asked what happened to the one I gave them the day before. I found out one of the officers had taken it from them for himself. It was a small thing but it was the principle of the matter not the value of a soccer ball. I went ballistic right there on the Iraqi Colonel that was their commanding officer and was over the thief Captain. I am sure I really offended the Colonel and the Captain (who I had already had several incidents with), but the soldiers got the ball back and the Colonel and the Captain were much easier to deal with afterwards. I am sure I sounded a lot like the video. After that incident that same group of IA soldiers just got better, they knew someone was looking out for them and they were the best group I had in my whole tour.
